Policy Transactions

v071822.1

Lesson
Oo bj ectives ¢ Describe the types of policy transactions

* Describe how PolicyCenter represents
policies

* View policy transactions

* View policies on a specific date

Simone EI
iE On a daily basis, | do policy associated work, like

f creating a new policy or changing policies mid-term.

| need to know how to do my job using the

software’s capabilities.

In order to write accurate
requirements, | need to know exactly
how policy transactions work.

For example, what if | had to write a
requirement describing a change to
the cancellation of a transaction?
Where would | start?

Marcus
Business
Analyst

| Policy transactions Gi

Policy Change

S_> Renewal

Not renewed

Policy
created

Expires

Cancellation

Reinstatement Rewrite

| Life span of a policy Gi

Effective Expiration Expiration
date date date

eee ES

Sys

¢ The length of time a policy is in force is determined by the effective date (start
date) and expiration date (end date)

* The time between these two dates is the policy term (e.g., six months, one year)
* The period of time when the policy is in effect

¢ During the life of the policy, one or more transactions can occur that changes the
policy

Gi

| Policy period — Guidewire terminology

Policy Effective Expiration
date

v

change’ date

NY

12:01 AM March 1, 2018

v

¢ The policy term and the policy period are not the same thing

¢ There can be multiple periods within a term
¢ The multiple periods in a single term are called split periods

| Submissions

Submission
[° e 4
Policy term

¢« Asubmission is a transaction that creates a policy

* Qualifying candidate

* Obtaining one or more quotes

* Binding and issuing policy when an acceptable quote is found
* Most do not end with a policy being issued

* Applicant may not qualify

e May not be an acceptable quote

| Policy change

Policy change

¢« Apolicy change changes the policy prior to the expiration date
* Some of the changes may be:

* Coverables added to or removed from a policy

* Coverages added to or removed from coverables

* Coverage terms modified

| Renewals Gi

No renewal (expires es
Renewal term

¢« Arenewal creates a new policy for another term, at the end of the policy term

+ May involve changes to coverables, coverages or premium

¢ If not renewed, the policy expires

| Cancellations

Cancellation

¢« Acancellation ends the policy before its expiration date
* Could be initiated by insured

* They found a better price elsewhere
* Could be initiated by insurer

* Insured may not have paid premiums

| Reinstatements

Cancellation Reinstatement

Effective date

¢« Areinstatement restores a cancelled policy with its original terms
* Cancellation and reinstatement always have same effective date
* No lapse in coverage

* Can occur when the issue causing cancellation has been rectified

* For example, insured pays overdue premiums

| Rewrites Gi

Cancellation Rewrite

“A ES

New policy term

A rewrite creates a new policy from an existing policy

* Typically performed when an error occured and the original policy does not reflect the
original policy’s intent

« New set of policy forms showing correct information is required

+ Rewrites are insurer-specific; there is no universal definition of what might cause a rewrite

J Mid-term rewrites
Cancellation Rewrite
Cl ey

Policy term

“summeeeeeeeeee

New policy term

¢« Amid-term rewrite replaces a portion of the original term and allows you to
rewrite the policy through to the original policy end date or to a new end date

« May create a lapse in coverage

| Rewrite new account

Rewrite
(om
Source account
. Policy term

Rewritten to target account

New policy term

* Takes data from an existing policy and creates a new policy with a new policy number in a
new account

¢ Rewrites policy to a new target account

¢ Rewrites only canceled or expired policies to a new account

¢ Policy terms can have a gap between them

| Review: Policy transactions Gi

Policy Change

S_> Renewal

Not renewed

Expires

Policy
created

Cancellation

Reinstatement Rewrite

Audits Gi

Premium Premium
report report Final audit

¢ Audits are line of business (LOB) specific

¢ Asubmission creates a policy with a premium based on estimated information
(such as the insured's revenue)

¢ Apremium report collects the actual data periodically within the policy term
* Can change policy premium

¢ A final audit may occur at the end of the term to ensure the policy does not reflect
estimated data

Marci
Configuration
Developer _.

| hear the term “policy job” a lot. What is the
relationship between transactions and jobs?

| Jobs

oo . oo .
Policy Policy
transaction job

¢ Policy Transactions are represented in PolicyCenter by Jobs
« Essentially "job" and "policy transaction" are synonymous

* “Policy Transaction” and “Transaction” are used in the user interface, while “Job” is used
throughout the configuration

¢ Jobs coordinate all of the work associated with creating and modifying a policy

| Things that define job logic Gi

aby

Job Processes Workflows Wizards

sit
i

ey

Product model Rules External systems

| Initiating jobs

Jobs can be started in three ways:

{_]
+ By users through the Actions menu @ ] —>
=

* By external systems through APIs r

* Through PolicyCenter batch processes

©

Gi

New Policy Transaction
‘change Policy
cancel Policy

Renew Policy

Marci
Configuration

Developer

How are policies represented in PolicyCenter?

| History of a policy Gi

Policy Second Teen driver Renewal
created auto added added (premium changed)
04/20/18 07/20/18 10/20/18 04/20/19

$450 J $920 $990

J $270 J
Co) = sc s= tea 2)

Policies often change over time
* Coverables and coverages are added or removed
« When a policy is renewed, rates (and therefore premiums) may change

* Policy may be canceled (and possibly reinstated)

| PolicyPeriods G

¢ APolicyPeriod is one "version" of the policy
* Has an effective date and an expiration date
* Model time is the actual real-world time when policies are created or jobs are bound
Model 4/20/18 7/20/18 10/20/18 04/20/19

SS Se + scone at $450
| See 2) + teen driver $920
SS _ 2) BSL) rerewai soo

3 versions, so 3 PolicyPeriods: 1 PP and 1 PT:
1 PolicyTerm: 04/20/18 — 04/20/19 04/20/19 — 04/20/20

| Transaction dates

Transaction dates Gi
4/20/18 7/20/18 10/20/18 04/20/19

[ve] Policy term: Policy term:

04/20/18 — 04/20/19 04/20/19 — 04/20/20
« When job becomes effective, it changes nature of policy

* Each job has a transaction effective date

¢ Transaction generally applies until end of the policy term

Tanya

Customer

Service
Representative

How can | view the policy transactions?

| View policy transactions Gi

* Click the policy transactions link on the account or policy pages to view the details
« Account File

* Summary page lists the open policy transactions related to the account

* Policy Transactions page lists all the transactions on the account
¢ Policy File

* Summary page has two sections: pending and completed policy transactions

* Policy Transactions page lists all the transactions on the policy
+ Multiple transactions can be selected and compared

Type + Effective Date > Transaction Status > Current Status
Policy Change 01/22/2018 Bound In Force

Policy Change 01/22/2018 Draft Draft

| Viewing policy on a specific date

Enter a date in the selector on the policy
file left menu to view the policy
information on that date

Question

_~ — 'satransaction a job? Explain.

4
¢
¢

SoS oD DD DDS De Say

Answer

¢
¢
¢
¢

Sop DD DD SDSS oe

Is a transaction a job? Explain.

The term "policy transaction" is typical in the industry and is used in the user interface.
The term "job" is used in the data model, in user interface configuration, and in
business rules.

Question

,~ — Acustomer calls and wants a new policy for another term at the end of
¢ policy term. What transaction is the customer asking for?

¢
¢

SoS oD DD DDS De Say

Gi

Answer

¢
¢
¢
¢

Sop DD DD SDSS oe

Acustomer calls and wants a new policy for another term, at the end of
policy term. What transaction is the customer asking for?

The customer wants a renewal.

Gi

Question

,~ — Acustomer wants a new coverage on an existing policy. What
x transaction will best suit this need?

SoS oD DD DDS De Say

Answer Gi

,~ — Acustomer wants a new coverage on an existing policy. What
x transaction will best suit this need?

A policy change is the most obvious transaction in this case. However, a rewrite may
be needed depending on the coverage details.

Sop DD DD SDSS oe

Lesson
Oo bj ectives ¢ Describe the types of policy transactions

review * Describe how PolicyCenter represents
policies
* View policy transactions
* View policies on a specific date
